scene_description_enriched: The scene depicts two figures. The upper figure, likely a prophet or saint, is shown from the waist up, wearing a crown and a richly decorated garment. They hold a book in their left hand and point with their right index finger. Below this figure, a second figure, possibly a king or a wise man, is depicted from the chest up, also wearing a crown and a patterned garment. A star with eight points shines above their head. The figures are framed by decorative architectural elements, including what appears to be a capital with acanthus leaves and a patterned frieze.
scene_interpretation: The presence of a star above the head of the lower figure, combined with the depiction of figures in regal or prophetic attire, strongly suggests a scene related to the Adoration of the Magi or the Annunciation to the Shepherds, where a star guides the wise men or shepherds to the nativity. The book held by the upper figure could represent scripture or prophecy.
